column1: Banes is a municipality and city in the Holguín Province of Cuba.
Banes was an important area for the native Taino people before the conquest by Columbus.
The town of Banes is visited by tourists from Guardalavaca as it is the nearest town to the resort
column2: and both are in the municipality of Banes. A museum featuring the Taino culture is situated halfway between both towns.

column1: The name comes from the inhabitants Taino language word Bani
column2: meaning "valley".Hurricane Ike made landfall here as a Category 4 hurricane on the evening of September 7

column1: The municipality is divided into the barrios of Barrio Amarillo

column2: the municipality of Banes had a population of 81
column3: 274. With a total area of 781 km2 (302 sq mi)
column4: it has a population density of 104.1/km2 (270/sq mi).
